system_context: Pattern-specific landing page section templates. Each pattern has 8-11 sections with specific content requirements.

sections.name: Quick Comparison Overview
sections.generation_prompt: Create a quick visual comparison showing 3-4 key stats where Sozee wins: LORA training time, NSFW support, pricing, ease of use. Format: Feature name | Sozee value | Competitor value

sections.name: Why Audience Are Switching
sections.generation_prompt: Create 3-4 benefit cards explaining why {audience} are switching from {competitor} to Sozee. Each card should: 1) Identify a specific problem with {competitor}, 2) Show how Sozee solves it better. Use competitor research data.

sections.name: Detailed Feature Comparison Table
sections.generation_prompt: Use Comparison Table Agent output. Ensure 8-10 features covering: LORA training, NSFW support, speed, ease of use, pricing, platform optimization, content quality, support, customization, and integration capabilities.

sections.name: Use Case Deep Dive
sections.generation_prompt: Create 2-3 detailed use case scenarios showing how {audience} use Sozee instead of {competitor}. Each scenario should tell a mini-story: the situation, what {competitor} couldn't do, how Sozee solved it, and the result. Use audience insight data.

sections.name: Problems with Competitor
sections.generation_prompt: Identify 3-4 specific problems {audience} face when using {competitor}. Be factual and empathetic (not attacking). Use competitor research data to ground each point. Examples: No NSFW support, complex interface, slow training times, poor creator workflows.

sections.name: Social Proof
sections.generation_prompt: Use statistics from Statistics Agent. Focus on testimonials from users who switched from {competitor} to Sozee. Include specific metrics: time saved, content volume increase, revenue impact.

content_requirements.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
qa_types: What features does Sozee have that {competitor} doesn't?
Will I lose my existing content?
What's included in the free trial?

sections.name: Final CTA
sections.generation_prompt: Create final CTA emphasizing risk-free trial and easy migration from {competitor}. Include specific guarantees: no credit card required, migration support, 1-click switch.

sections.name: Authority Badges
sections.generation_prompt: Create authority indicators showing why Sozee ranks #1. Include: 'Top-rated by {audience}', usage statistics from Statistics Agent, recognition indicators. Format as visual badges.

sections.name: Why Sozee Ranks #1
sections.generation_prompt: List 5-6 specific reasons Sozee ranks as the best {use_case} for {audience}. Each should be a clear competitive advantage with evidence. Examples: Fastest LORA training (30 min), NSFW support, creator-specific features, easiest interface, best results, most integrations.

sections.name: Feature Showcase

content_requirements.heading: Features That Put Us Ahead
content_requirements.feature_structure: Feature name → Benefit → How it helps {audience}

sections.generation_prompt: Showcase 4-6 features that make Sozee #1. Each feature should include: name, benefit statement, and specific way it helps {audience}. Focus on differentiators: Custom LORA, 1-Click TikTok Cloning, NSFW Support, Speed, Creator Workflows.

sections.name: Comparison to Alternatives

content_requirements.heading: How We Compare to Other Tools
content_requirements.note: Show advantages without naming specific competitors

sections.generation_prompt: Create a comparison table showing Sozee vs 'Other Tools' (generic). Highlight 6-8 features where Sozee excels: LORA training time, NSFW support, creator focus, ease of use, content quality, pricing, support, customization.

sections.name: Use Case Success Stories

content_requirements.heading: How {audience} Use Sozee
content_requirements.case_structure: Before scenario → After with Sozee → Results

sections.generation_prompt: Create 3 use case success stories showing {audience} using Sozee for {use_case}. Each should show: what they struggled with before, how they use Sozee now, and specific results (time saved, content created, revenue growth).

sections.name: Results & ROI

content_requirements.heading: Results {audience} Get with Sozee
content_requirements.metrics: Time saved, content volume, revenue impact

sections.generation_prompt: Present results and ROI data from Statistics Agent. Show concrete outcomes: average time saved per week, content output increase (1 shoot → 10,000 photos), revenue impact, creator retention. Use specific numbers.

content_requirements.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
qa_types: What makes Sozee the best {use_case} for {audience}?
How does Sozee compare to other tools?
Is Sozee really better than competitors?

sections.name: Final CTA
sections.generation_prompt: Final CTA emphasizing joining the best-ranked tool for {use_case}. Highlight free trial, no credit card required, join top {audience}.

sections.name: Platform-Specific Benefits
sections.generation_prompt: List 4 benefits specific to {platform}. Examples for OnlyFans: optimized aspect ratios, NSFW capabilities, fan engagement features, subscription content volume. Each benefit should directly relate to {platform}'s unique requirements.

sections.name: How It Works

content_requirements.heading: From Idea to {platform} Content in Minutes

sections.generation_prompt: Create a 3-4 step process showing how to create {platform} content with Sozee. Steps: 1) Upload photos (10-20), 2) AI trains LORA model (30 min), 3) Generate unlimited content (30 sec/photo), 4) Post to {platform}. Include time estimates.

sections.name: Key Features
sections.generation_prompt: List 5-6 features optimized for {platform}. Each should include the technical capability and the {platform}-specific benefit. Examples: Custom LORA training → content that looks exactly like you for {platform} subscribers, NSFW support → unrestricted {platform} content.

sections.name: Speed & Scale
sections.generation_prompt: Show speed and scale advantages using Statistics Agent data. Compare traditional content creation (1 photoshoot = 50 photos) vs Sozee (1 photoshoot = 10,000+ photos). Include time metrics: traditional shoot (4-8 hours) vs Sozee generation (30 sec/photo).

sections.name: Platform Integration

content_requirements.heading: Seamless {platform} Workflow
content_requirements.details: How it fits into existing process, export formats, compatibility

sections.generation_prompt: Explain how Sozee integrates into {platform} workflows. Include: export formats optimized for {platform}, file specifications, posting workflow, content organization. Show it fits seamlessly into their existing process.

sections.name: Use Cases
sections.generation_prompt: List 6-8 types of content {audience} can create for {platform} using Sozee. Examples: profile photos, subscription content, custom requests, themed sets, seasonal content, promotional materials. Each should be {platform}-relevant.

content_requirements.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
qa_types: How realistic will my {platform} content look?
How fast can I generate content?
Can I create NSFW content for {platform}?
What's included in the free trial?
Can I use this for {platform} subscriptions?

sections.name: Final CTA
sections.generation_prompt: Final CTA focused on starting to create {platform} content. Emphasize free trial, platform optimization, immediate results.

sections.name: Why Switch
sections.generation_prompt: Identify 4 specific pain points {audience} experience with {competitor} using competitor research data. Be empathetic and factual. Examples: No NSFW support limits {platform} creators, 3-hour LORA training kills productivity, Complex interface requires technical skills, Limited customization for creator workflows.

sections.name: What Sozee Does Differently
sections.generation_prompt: For each pain point with {competitor}, show how Sozee solves it. Format: {competitor} problem → Sozee solution. Use specific features and benefits. Example: {competitor} blocks NSFW → Sozee offers full NSFW support built for creators.

sections.name: Feature Comparison Table
sections.generation_prompt: Use Comparison Table Agent output. Focus on features {competitor} lacks that Sozee has. Highlight gaps in {competitor} offering.

sections.name: Easy Migration
sections.generation_prompt: Create 3-step migration guide from {competitor} to Sozee. Include: 1) Sign up and upload photos (10 min), 2) Train your LORA model (30 min automatic), 3) Start generating (instant). Emphasize: no data loss, quick process, migration support available.

sections.name: Pricing Comparison
sections.generation_prompt: Compare Sozee pricing to {competitor} if competitor pricing is known. Sozee: Creators $15/week, Agencies $33/week. Show value proposition: better features at competitive/lower price. If competitor pricing unknown, emphasize Sozee's transparent, affordable pricing.

sections.name: What You'll Gain

content_requirements.heading: What {audience} Get by Switching
content_requirements.outcome_types: Time savings, cost savings, capability gains

sections.generation_prompt: Show 3-4 concrete outcomes from switching to Sozee. Use Statistics Agent data. Examples: Save 20 hours/week on content creation, Generate 100x more content from same photoshoot, Access NSFW capabilities, Reduce technical complexity. Include specific metrics.

content_requirements.heading: Switching from {competitor}? Your Questions Answered
qa_types: Why should I switch from {competitor} to Sozee?
Will I lose my existing work when switching?
How much will I save by switching?
Can I try Sozee before switching fully?

sections.name: Final CTA
sections.generation_prompt: Final CTA emphasizing easy, risk-free switch from {competitor}. Include guarantees: free trial, migration support, no commitment. Reinforce key advantages over {competitor}.

sections.name: Quick Verdict

content_requirements.best_for: Specific use cases where Sozee excels

sections.generation_prompt: Create honest quick verdict. Rating: 4.7-4.9/5. Best for: {audience} who need high-volume, realistic content for {platform}. Not ideal for: users needing generic stock photos or without consistent personal brand. Bottom line: summarize when Sozee is the right choice.

sections.name: Pros Section
sections.generation_prompt: List 5-7 genuine pros of Sozee. Examples: Fastest LORA training (30 min vs competitors' 3+ hours), Full NSFW support for creators, Hyper-realistic results, 1-Click TikTok cloning, No technical skills required, Built specifically for creators, Transparent pricing. Each needs 1-2 sentence explanation.

sections.name: Cons Section
sections.generation_prompt: List 2-3 honest limitations to show balanced review. Examples: Requires initial 30-min LORA training (not instant), Best results need 15-20 training photos (quality over quantity), Focused on creator content (not ideal for generic stock photos). This builds trust by being honest.

sections.name: Feature Breakdown
sections.generation_prompt: Rate 6-8 key features. Examples: LORA Training (5/5 - fastest in class), Content Quality (4.8/5 - hyper-realistic), Ease of Use (4.9/5 - no tech skills needed), NSFW Support (5/5 - unrestricted), Speed (4.7/5 - 30 sec per image), Platform Integration (4.5/5 - optimized for creators), Pricing (4.8/5 - transparent and affordable), Support (4.6/5 - responsive team).

sections.name: Who It's Perfect For

content_requirements.heading: Best Fit for These {audience} Types
content_requirements.persona_structure: Type of {audience} → Why Sozee works for them

sections.generation_prompt: Define 3-4 specific {audience} personas who benefit most from Sozee. Examples: High-volume OnlyFans creators needing daily content, Agencies managing multiple creator accounts, Models with limited photoshoot availability, Creators in restrictive NSFW categories. Explain why each persona benefits.

sections.name: Who Should Look Elsewhere

content_requirements.heading: When Sozee Might Not Be Right
content_requirements.limitations: 2-3 scenarios where other tools might be better

sections.generation_prompt: Honestly identify 2-3 scenarios where Sozee might not be the best fit. Examples: If you need generic stock photos (not personalized content), If you're creating corporate/business headshots, If you need instant results without any training time. This honesty builds trust in the review.

sections.name: Pricing Analysis
sections.generation_prompt: Analyze Sozee pricing and ROI. Pricing: Creators $15/week (~$60/month), Agencies $33/week (~$132/month). Compare to traditional photoshoot costs ($500-2000/shoot) and content output (1 shoot = 50 photos traditional vs 10,000+ photos with Sozee). Show clear ROI for {audience}.

sections.name: Final Verdict
sections.generation_prompt: Provide final verdict with clear recommendation. Format: 'We recommend Sozee for {audience} who [conditions]'. Try it if: you need high-volume personalized content, you want to scale without burnout, you create NSFW content for {platform}, you manage multiple creators. Include 'Try the free trial to see if it fits your workflow.'

content_requirements.heading: Your Questions About Sozee Answered
qa_types: What are Sozee's main pros and cons?
What do real {audience} say about Sozee?
How does Sozee compare to competitors?

sections.name: Final CTA

content_requirements.heading: Try It Yourself
content_requirements.body: Emphasize free trial to test the review claims

sections.generation_prompt: Final CTA encouraging users to verify review with free trial. Emphasize: test everything in the review yourself, no credit card required, see if it fits your {audience} needs.

sections.name: The Problem (Statistics)
sections.generation_prompt: Present 4-6 compelling statistics from Statistics Agent about the content crisis. Examples: 78% of creators report burnout, Average creator posts 1 photo/day but fans want 100+, $500-2000 per photoshoot limits content volume, Creators spend 60% of time creating vs engaging fans, Content demand grows 10x faster than creator capacity. Use urgent visual style.

sections.name: The 1/100 Reality

content_requirements.heading: Your Fans Want 100 Posts. You Can Create 1.
content_requirements.data: Industry data on content supply vs demand

sections.generation_prompt: Visualize the 1/100 problem. Show: Fans want 100 pieces of new content, Creators can produce 1-2 pieces (traditional methods), Supply/demand gap = 98-99% unmet demand. Use Statistics Agent data on creator capacity vs fan expectations. Make the gap visually dramatic and urgent.

sections.name: Why Traditional Solutions Fail

content_requirements.heading: Why Photoshoots and Manual Creation Don't Scale
content_requirements.reason_structure: Problem → Why it doesn't scale → Impact

sections.generation_prompt: Identify 3-4 fundamental problems with traditional content creation. Examples: 1) Photoshoots ($500-2000 each) → unsustainable at scale → limits growth, 2) Time constraints (4-8 hours per shoot) → can't keep up with demand → burnout, 3) Physical/location limits → can't create 24/7 → missed revenue, 4) Quality pressure → perfectionism slows output → fan churn. Show why traditional methods can't solve the crisis.

sections.name: The Sozee Solution

content_requirements.heading: How Sozee Solves the Content Crisis

sections.generation_prompt: Explain how Sozee fundamentally solves the 1/100 problem. Key points: 1 photoshoot (15-20 photos) trains custom AI model in 30 minutes, Generate unlimited hyper-realistic content (30 sec per photo), Same face, body, style - infinite variations, Solve supply problem permanently. Use simple language to explain LORA training without technical jargon.

sections.name: Scale Without Burnout

content_requirements.heading: Create Unlimited Content Without Burning Out

sections.generation_prompt: Show 4 transformations Sozee enables. Examples: From 1 photoshoot/month → Unlimited daily content, From 8 hours per shoot → 30 seconds per image, From physical burnout → Creative freedom, From revenue ceiling → Unlimited growth potential. Use before/after format showing the dramatic shift.

sections.name: Real Impact

content_requirements.heading: From Crisis to Abundance
content_requirements.typical_day: Day in the life before vs after Sozee

sections.generation_prompt: Create before/after stories showing real impact. Include: Typical day before (photoshoot planning, travel, shooting, editing = 12 hours for 50 photos), Typical day after (30 min LORA training once, then generate 200 photos in 1 hour anytime), Creator testimonials about eliminated burnout and increased revenue. Show emotional and practical impact.

sections.name: How It Works

content_requirements.heading: Your Content Crisis Solution in 3 Steps
content_requirements.step_details: Upload photos → 30-min LORA training → Infinite generation

sections.generation_prompt: Simple 3-step process: 1) Upload 15-20 photos (one-time, 10 minutes), 2) AI trains your LORA model (30 minutes automatic), 3) Generate unlimited content (30 seconds per photo, forever). Emphasize: do step 1-2 once, then step 3 infinitely. This solves the crisis permanently.

sections.name: ROI of Solving the Crisis

content_requirements.heading: What You Gain by Ending the Crisis
content_requirements.metrics: Time back, revenue increase, mental health, growth potential

sections.generation_prompt: Calculate ROI of solving content crisis using Statistics Agent data. Show: Time saved (20+ hours/week freed up), Revenue increase (10x content = 3-5x revenue), Mental health (eliminate burnout, stress), Growth potential (unlimited content = unlimited scaling). Use specific numbers where possible.

content_requirements.heading: Content Crisis Questions Answered
qa_types: What is the content crisis for {audience}?
How does Sozee solve the 1/100 problem?
Can I really generate unlimited content?
Will my fans notice if I use AI content?
How long does LORA training take?
How much does it cost vs traditional methods?

sections.name: Final CTA

content_requirements.heading: End Your Content Crisis Today
content_requirements.crisis_calculator: Optional: tool to calculate their supply/demand gap

sections.generation_prompt: Urgent final CTA emphasizing ending the content crisis permanently. Include: Start free trial and solve crisis in 30 minutes, No more burnout or content bottlenecks, Unlimited content = unlimited growth, Crisis calculator to show their personal gap. Use urgent but empowering language.
